intro: Micromeria arganietorum, commonly known as the Canary Island thyme, is a small shrub native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Labiatae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its tiny, fragrant leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
